title: God'n Spy - Geo-Political Simulator 5
description: With the God'n'Spy add-on, you can be the master of Geo-Political Simulator 5 and intervene in world events by accessing all the key factors of the game, manipulating them as you see fit and creating or modifying events at any moment.
longDescription:
<!--textBlock-->
<!--title-->
# With the God'n'Spy add-on, be the master of Geo-Political Simulator 5 and intervene in world events by accessing all variables.
<!--text-->
God' N Spy Add-on 
for Geo-Political Simulator 5

With the God'n'Spy add-on, you can be the master of Geo-Political Simulator 5 and intervene in world events by accessing all the key factors of the game, manipulating them as you see fit and creating or modifying events at any moment ! 


At any moment, by using this game mode, you can access internal hidden game engine variables, you can modify some of these variables and create and delete events. 
This gameplay mode will also allow you to come back as another character and continue to play if you lose your game.
It allows you to add, at any point during the game, any head of state or CEO of a multinational to the playable characters.
      
      List of variables to explore 
    • the ideological alignment between your head-of-state character and your government and your political party 
    • your energy level, as perceived by the public 
    • the list of themes that you have addressed 
    • the political trends of other heads of state 
    • the dictatorship level of other states 
    • the level of responsibility of belligerent factions involved in conflicts 
    • the political leanings and the electoral weight of any character 
    • the preferred themes of any character 
    • the level of severity of a disaster, disturbance, or terrorist attack 
    • the analysis of an economic agreement before its approval 
    • detailed electoral results at any time, as if the elections had taken place that very day 
    • information on your opponent 
    • protest movement popularity levels 
    • pertinence level of beginning a protest movement by your party 
    • pertinence level of inciting a group to begin a protest movement. if you lose one round, the possibility for continuing the game with the new head of state 

      List of modifiable variables: 
    • extraordinary revenues of a state enabling it to dispose of a superior budget 
    • the cash reserves and notoriety of companies
    • your own popularity 
    • your health 
    • economic and strategic relationships between countries 
    • the popularity rate of any character 
    • the loyalty of any character in reference to your character (head of state, political opponent, or CEO of a multinational)
    • for any character: their level of experience, charisma, health, positive outlook, and political interest; their moral character, degree of influence, level of protection, and resistance to alcohol 
    • the acceleration of hiring for civil servants or researchers in companies
    • rejection or approval of any national bill or UN international resolution proposal 
    • the number of military units (for all kinds of arms) 
    • the possibility to immediately finalize construction projects (for nations and companies)
    • the possibility for having immediate success in actions from secret services or agent 001 
    • if you lose one round, the possibility for continuing the game with the new head of state 
    • revenue of your legal party or illegal organization 
    • the armed forces of your illegal organization 
    • the number of rockets and missiles in your legal or illegal army 
    • the possibility of finding all the camouflaged rebel camps with your drones 
    • the possibility of keeping your camouflaged rebel camps invisible indefinitely 
    • the possibility of normalizing your illegal organization. 
      
List of events to create, terminate, or delete: 
    • automatic approval of any agreement between nations or economic contract between companies
    • automatic validation of financial and strategic actions of the CEO of a multinational (IPO, takeover bid, capital increase...)
    • scandals concerning any character 
    • natural disasters 
    • disturbances 
    • armed conflicts with the choice of the winner and level of responsibility of the belligerent factions 
    • terrorist acts (attacks, hostage taking) 
    • conflict with terrorist organizations 
    • city battles
